data.description: ACT FOUR is a structural narrative marker within the script, denoting the beginning of the fourth act of the story. It appears as a scene heading or title card following the conclusion of Act Three, signaling a transition in the narrative. It is not a character in the traditional sense but a dramatic division label embedded within the script's formatting.
data.dialogue_summary: ACT FOUR has no dialogue. It functions solely as a structural label marking the transition from Act Three to Act Four of the screenplay.
